channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MO

item.title: Report X-2023121148
item.description:
Report X-2023121148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A SOLVENT-LIKE ODOR BY THE LOADER ON THE PD-8. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND DONNING THE PROPER PPE. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE TOP SECTION OF A METAL 5-GAL PAIL WAS SLIGHTLY DENTED, CREATING A BREACH THAT CAUSED APPROX. 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK FROM AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 44 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report X-2023121147
item.description:
Report X-2023121147

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY MARKED AND REGULATED HAZMAT THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED IN A TRAILER IN UNLOAD C. THE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED. DONNING THE APPROPRIATE PPE AND USING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE CAPS ON EACH ONE OF THE FOUR INNER CONTAINERS WERE LOOSE BY 1/4 TURN AND APPROXIMATELY 2 OUNCES HAD LEAKED OUT ONTO THE OUTER CARTON AND INNER PARTION.

item.title: Report X-2023120909
item.description:
Report X-2023120909

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the A Wing and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: All four jugs of phosphoric suffered inward denting of their spouts/caps but only two suffered cracks to their caps allowing for a spill to occur. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the Hazmat cage on the Vent to allow the fumes to dissipate.

item.title: Report X-2023121051
item.description:
Report X-2023121051

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING WAS DISCOVERED IN A TRAILER IN UNLOAD C BY AN UNLOADER. THE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES DONNING THE CORRECT PPE. THE CONTAINER APPEARED TO BE WET AND A SMALL PUNCTURE HOLE WAS DISCOVED NEAR THE BOTTOM. USING THE DECISION TREE IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING. THE CONTAINER WAS A PLASTIC 5 GALLON JUG AND DID NOT HAVE ANY OUTER PACKAGING.

item.title: Report X-2023121045
item.description:
Report X-2023121045

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE HAZ-MAT WAS FOUND TO BE LEAKING ON THE FLOOR OF THE PD-9 OUTBOUND DOCK OF THE EARTH CITY, MO UPS HUB. THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND UPRIGHT WITH A DAMP CORNER ON THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX. THE SPILL WAS CLEANED, CONTAINED, AND TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. AN INTERNAL INSPECTION REVEALED NO PACKING MATERIAL TO PROTECT THE INNER RECEPTACLES (1 GALLON CLOSED HEAD METAL BOTTLES) FROM THE SHIPPING PROCESS.

item.title: Report E-2023120387
item.description:
Report E-2023120387

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: HAYTI
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LLR experienced an over the road release of NA1993 Spec-Aid* 8Q123ULS from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of product released to a 1’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to a crack in the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were deployed to clean the impacted area. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all impacted absorbents into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was removed from site pending disposal.

item.title: Report I-2023090105
item.description:
Report I-2023090105

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-31T00:35:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While driving a loaded trailer, a driver hit the brakes to avoid a vehicle collision. The container load shifted forward and a 55DF of Chromic Acid sludge was damaged. The contents of the drum leaked from the bottom and sides of the trailer floor onto the roadway and plant parking lot surface. Stormwater collected on the KC Plant parking lot was impacted by the spill.
